reasoning: Increasing the confidence threshold to 0.35 will reduce the inclusion of irrelevant items, improving precision. Raising the content classification threshold to 0.20 will further refine the filtering of anchor-related content. Reducing skip_pages to 2 ensures potentially relevant pages are not overlooked. Increasing image_size_min to 120 will help exclude smaller, less detailed images that may not provide meaningful anchor information. Lowering max_extractions to 12 will focus on higher-quality items, avoiding over-extraction of marginally relevant content.

quality_scores.overall_assessment: The extraction process captured relevant anchors-related content, including text summaries, images, and tables. However, there were some issues with precision, as a few items were either misclassified or lacked sufficient detail to confirm their relevance. The alignment with reference data was generally strong, but there is room for improvement in filtering out irrelevant content and ensuring all anchor types are represented.

reasoning: Increasing the confidence_threshold to 0.45 will reduce false positives and improve precision, ensuring only high-confidence items are extracted. Raising the content_classification_threshold to 0.3 will help filter out irrelevant content, especially in text summaries. Reducing skip_pages to 1 ensures more pages are analyzed, potentially capturing missing anchor types. Increasing image_size_min to 150 will eliminate smaller, less detailed images that may not provide useful information. Lowering max_extractions to 10 will focus on extracting the most relevant items, avoiding redundancy and improving overall quality.
